pullRequest.body:
Prove the Kruskal-Katona theorem.

From LeanCamCombi

Co-authored-by: Bhavik Mehta <bhavikmehta8@gmail.com>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [c9d145fb02](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15000/commits/c9d145fb029fb56641e646ea7abf4b8d3a9f2aad)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SetFamily.KruskalKatona`|745|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsInitSeg.shadow`
`+ isInitSeg_of_compressed`
`+ iterated_kk`
`+ kruskal_katona`
`+ shadow_initSeg`
`+ shadow_mono`
`+ toColex_compress_lt_toColex`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Annoying. Let's at least make sure this issue is logged somewhere else -
even if only on zulip - and not just in this file

On Sun, 11 Aug 2024, 23:06 Yaël Dillies, ***@***.***> wrote:

> ***@***.**** commented on this pull request.
> ------------------------------
>
> In Mathlib/Combinatorics/SetFamily/KruskalKatona.lean
> <https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15000#discussion_r1713066836>
> :
>
> > +    sdiff_nonempty.2 fun h ↦ hAB.symm $ eq_of_subset_of_card_le h hAB'.le
> +  have disj : Disjoint (B \ A) (A \ B) := disjoint_sdiff.mono_left sdiff_subset
> +  have smaller : max' _ hV < max' _ hU := by
> +    obtain hlt | heq | hgt := lt_trichotomy (max' _ hU) (max' _ hV)
> +    · rw [← compress_sdiff_sdiff A B] at hAB hBA
> +      cases hBA.not_lt $ toColex_compress_lt_toColex hlt hAB
> +    · exact (disjoint_right.1 disj (max'_mem _ hU) $ heq.symm ▸ max'_mem _ _).elim
> +    · assumption
> +  refine hB ?_
> +  rw [← (h₂ _ _ ⟨disj, card_sdiff_comm hAB'.symm, hV, hU, smaller⟩).eq]
> +  exact mem_compression.2 (Or.inr ⟨hB, A, hA, compress_sdiff_sdiff _ _⟩)
> +
> +attribute [-instance] Fintype.decidableForallFintype
> +
> +-- TODO: There's currently a diamond
> +-- import Mathlib.Data.Fin.Basic
>
> It's a bit of a mix since it goes through LinearOrder.liftWithOrd which
> is in mathlib, but the original sin is that instDecidableEqFin does not
> agree with decidable_of_iff, and both of these are in core
>
> —
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15000#discussion_r1713066836>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AHESIOUVABVCSC3UDCFI4VLZQ7N6PAVCNFSM6AAAAABLHQ6LVOVHI2DSMVQWIX3LMV43YUDVNRWFEZLROVSXG5CSMV3GSZLXHMZDEMZRHA4TQNZYGM>
> .
> You are receiving this because you commented.Message ID:
> ***@***.***>
>
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by b-mehta.

Build failed:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10526848556/job/29168640108)

bors r+
Just in case,
bors d+

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10538861289/job/29201810616)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10538861289/job/29201810724)

LGTM. Let's make sure to get another review on this though, again I wrote too much of it!

maintainer merge

LGTM. Let's make sure to get another review on this though, again I wrote too much of it!

maintainer merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
Let's make a PR to fix this issue.
To the Lean 4 repo?
Is this a Lean 4 issue? That's not clear from the description you give here.

It's a bit of a mix since it goes through `LinearOrder.liftWithOrd` which is in mathlib, but the original sin is that `instDecidableEqFin` does not agree with `decidable_of_iff`, and both of these are in Init.

I would encourage you to try my MWE

> Annoying. Let's at least make sure this issue is logged somewhere else - even if only on zulip - and not just in this file

https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/270676-lean4/topic/DecidableEq.20diamond.20on.20Fin

```suggestion
/-- The **Kruskal-Katona theorem**.

Given a set family `𝒜` consisting of `r`-sets, and `𝒞` an initial segment of the colex order of the
```

This isn't strictly true, since the definition of initial segments of colex that's used below depends on the order of the ground set. What is true, however, is that the *size* of C doesn't depend on the order of the ground set. 
The original motivation for the todo on the order iso between colex and Nat was to make the statement of KK genuinely not depend on the order of the ground set, so I wonder if @apnelson1's recent work makes the statements below nicer.

I mean, the better way of doing things is the k-cascade representation, right? It's a bit annoying that I lost my work on that due to some git misshap, but I could possibly redo it if you think that making the statement order-independent is so important
I think we shouldn't write something in a docstring that's false
I don't think the docstring is false? It's true that `kruskal_katona` is order-dependent, but it's also true that the (usual) mathematical statement of Kruskal-Katona is not.
Then let's make sure that's clear in the docstring
I think we should put this (and maybe the lovasz form) in a different PR so each is easier to review.
weird quotes here?
No longer present

```suggestion
  -- Yes. Then apply the smallest compression, then keep going
```
tempting to try strong induction on family measure here... but can leave it for now if you want
That was easy :)
private, probably? familyMeasure is private  and `kruskal_katona_helper` is too
Rah yes I always assume that lemmas whose type include a private definition are themselves private, but this seems not to be the case.
I have opened https://github.com/leanprover/lean4/issues/5002 to possibly fix this confusing behavior

```suggestion
/-- We can strengthen Kruskal-Katona slightly: note the cardinality assumption has been relaxed to a `≤`.
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: The Kruskal-Katona theorem
